tech_news.title: Why There's Simply No Need For An iPad Anymore - bgr.com
tech_news.description: Apple may finally be releasing the iPhone Fold this year, as well as a MacBook with touchscreen capabilities, eliminating the need for an iPad.

tech_news.title: Android adds ‘Failed Authentication Lock’ setting, boosts failed passcode lockout - 9to5Google
tech_news.description: Google today detailed the latest device theft protection features for Android across stronger authentication and enhanced recovery tools.

tech_news.title: Two Cancelled Virtual Boy Games Coming To NSO In 2026, Including F-Zero Spin-Off - Nintendo Life

tech_news.title: Inside Google's vision to make Gmail your personal AI agent command center - ZDNET
tech_news.description: I spoke with Gmail VP of Product Blake Barnes to better understand Gmail's latest AI updates. Behind them lies a much larger idea.

tech_news.title: The Samsung Trifold will cost nearly three grand - The Verge
tech_news.description: The Galaxy Z Trifold has an official US launch date and price — just be prepared to pay up.

tech_news.title: Dr Disrespect Says His Fake Highguard Preview Badge Photo Was Just 'Poking Fun' After Dev Confirms He Was Not Invited to Play Early - IGN
tech_news.description: The developer of Highguard has confirmed streamer Dr Disrespect did not attend a preview event after he created a fake badge and pretended to have been invited to play the game early. Dr Disrespect responded to say he was "poking fun."

tech_news.title: iOS 26.2.1: Apple Suddenly Releases Surprise iPhone Update With Key Features And Fixes - Forbes
tech_news.description: Recently, it looked like a minor iPhone update was coming, but then it vanished without trace. Now, it’s just gone live.

tech_news.title: Xbox Cloud Gaming’s new design teases the future of Xbox console UI - The Verge
tech_news.description: Microsoft has started testing a new Xbox Cloud Gaming design. The updated UI includes new animations that make it look and feel much more console-like.

tech_news.title: Valve to face UK class action lawsuit with proposed damages of £656m - GamesIndustry.biz
tech_news.description: The case was filed back in 2024, but no date has been set for the trial yet
